abstract: OPEC downgrades demand outlook for its crude oil in 2015; reports demand will be 28.8 million barrels a day, down 100,000 a day from previous estimate; shows no intention to cut production, implying oversupply of more than 2 million barrels a day in first half of 2015.
lead_paragraph: The report said that demand for crude would fall to 28.8 million barrels per day this year, 100,000 barrels a day less than it forecast last month.
snippet: The report said that demand for crude would fall to 28.8 million barrels per day this year, 100,000 barrels a day less than it forecast last month.

keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: OPEC Report Downgrades Demand for Its Oil as Prices Fall Again
headline.print_headline: OPEC Forecast Points to Persistent Oil Glut for 2015
